contest-event.event-date:
Nov. 9, 2019 D US Open Brass Band Championships
US Open Brass Band Championships 0 Entertainments Contest
us-open-brass-band-championships
First Contest 2003.
Lied Center for Performing Arts, University of Kansas, Lawrence, Kansas, USA Most entertaining Band: Fountain City Brass Band Best featured Brass Soloist: Ryan Sharp - Cornet (Frontier Brass Band) Best Performance of a March (Roy Newsome Memorial Award): Prairie Brass Band (playing The Cross of Honour - William Rimmer) Best new Composition or Arrangement: Time in a Bottle (played by Colorado Brass)
Best Soprano Cornet: ? (Prairie Brass Band) Best Cornet: Ryan Sharp (Frontier Brass Band) Best Flugel Horn: Matthew Vangjel (Fountain City Brass Band) Best Horn: Geoff Tyndall (Colorado Brass) Best Baritone: Helen Harrelson (Fountain City Brass Band) Best Trombone: Dave Ellis (Colorado Brass) Best Euphonium: Matt van Emmerik (Fountain City Brass Band) Best Bass Section: Fountain City Brass Band Best Percussion Section: Fountain City Brass Band
temp. Link (Videos av.): Videos av.: https://vimeo.com/302667990 (2018) https://www.facebook.com/pg/USOPENBRASSBAND/videos/?ref=page_internal
Nov. 12, 2019, 4 p.m. Nov. 12, 2019, 4:15 p.m.
1 Fountain City Brass Joseph Parisi
2 Frontier Brass Band Andrew Barrington
3 Free State Brass Band Scott Watson
4 Fountain City Youth Brass Academy Lee Harrelson
5 Colorado Brass Ron Stinson
